document: Algorithms, Asymptotic Analysis, and Sorting Algorithms from the provided lecture notes.

questions.question: Which sorting algorithm repeatedly compares adjacent elements and swaps them if they are out of order?
What is the worst‑case time complexity of Bubble Sort on an array of n elements?
In the worst case, how many passes does Bubble Sort perform on an array of size n?
Which sorting algorithm repeatedly selects the minimum element from an unsorted sub‑array and swaps it with the first element of that sub‑array?
What is the best‑case time complexity of Selection Sort when the array is already sorted?
Which algorithm has a best‑case runtime of O(n) when the input array is sorted?
Which function represents linear growth in asymptotic notation?
Which function represents polynomial growth of degree three?
Which function represents exponential growth base 2?
During a sequential search, if the searched item is at the first position of an array of size n, what is the time complexity?
During a sequential search, if the searched item is not present in an array of size n, what is the time complexity?
What does the symbol c₁ represent in a recurrence for algorithm analysis?
Which sorting technique requires O(n log n) comparisons in the average case?
If an array contains a sequence of 10 integers, how many times will the inner loop of Bubble Sort run in total?
Which algorithm’s worst‑case runtime is described by T(n) = n + c₁ + c₂n + c₃n + 1?
What is the typical runtime of Insertion Sort when the array is reversed (worst‑case)?
Which function best describes the growth of a linear search algorithm?
What does the notation O(1) represent in algorithm analysis?
